companyAffiliation.title: Company Registration
companyAffiliation.entreReq1: Application addressed to the National/Regional or Provincial Delegate Authority
companyAffiliation.entreReq5: Copy of ID Card/Passport or Residence Permit of the company manager
companyAffiliation.entreReq6: List of workers and their salaries
companyAffiliation.publicReq1: Application addressed to the National/Regional or Provincial Delegate Authority
companyAffiliation.publicReq3: Copy of the Decree-Law creating the company
companyAffiliation.publicReq4: List of workers and their salaries
companyAffiliation.publicReq5: Copy of ID Card of the company's General Director
companyAffiliation.senatorTitle: If you are a Senator or Deputy for your card application
companyAffiliation.ministriesText: Ministries are automatically registered by default, being part of a common employer which is the Government
companyAffiliation.termReq1: Application addressed to the National/Regional or Provincial Delegate Authority
companyAffiliation.termReq2: Copy of termination granted by the General Directorate of Taxes and Contributions
companyAffiliation.termReq3: Copies of worker settlements delivered to them or duly endorsed by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security

workerAffiliation.title: Worker Affiliation
workerAffiliation.description: This is the act by which a worker, whether employed in the private or public sector, or self-employed, officially registers with INSESO in order to receive social protection: pension, health care, sickness or accident benefits, family benefits, etc.
workerAffiliation.privateReq2: Copy of ID Card/Passport or Residence Permit for foreigners
workerAffiliation.publicReq2: Copy of the last THREE (3) payslips
workerAffiliation.autonomousReq1: Application addressed to the National/Regional or Provincial Delegate Authority
workerAffiliation.autonomousReq3: Salary declaration, the current recognized minimum is 300,000 FCFAs
workerAffiliation.autonomousReq4: Copy of ID Card/Passport or Residence Permit for expatriates
workerAffiliation.terminationReq1: Application addressed to the National/Regional or Provincial Delegate Authority
workerAffiliation.terminationReq2: Copy of dismissal letter with worker's acknowledgment of receipt
workerAffiliation.terminationReq3: Copy of final settlement with delivery to worker

membership.functionText: The main function of social security affiliation is to incorporate a person into the social security system and, therefore, guarantee their access to the benefits and services it offers. Affiliation is mandatory for people who perform a work activity that includes them in the system.
membership.implies1: Identification: The person who affiliates receives a Social Security Number (NUSS), which identifies them within the system
membership.implies2: Registration: Affiliation is done through the General Affiliation Control service
membership.implies3: Rights and obligations: Affiliation establishes the person's rights and obligations within the system, such as the right to receive benefits for illness, maternity, old age, etc., and the obligation to contribute to social security.
membership.importanceSubtitle: The importance of affiliation lies in the fact that:
membership.importance1: It guarantees protection in case of contingencies (need): It allows access to health services, economic benefits and other benefits in case of illness, work accident, maternity, etc.
membership.importance2: It facilitates access to benefits: It allows access to retirement, disability, widowhood pensions, etc.
membership.importance3: It is a requirement to access certain labor rights: It is necessary to exercise rights such as access to public health, welfare benefits such as social action, etc.
membership.registrationTitle: HOW IS COMPANY REGISTRATION AND WORKER AFFILIATION CARRIED OUT?
membership.registrationText: The registration of companies and workers is initially simultaneous. It occurs through the presentation by companies of the requirements listed in the attached sheet.
membership.whoShouldTitle: WHO SHOULD AFFILIATE WITH SOCIAL SECURITY?
membership.whoShouldText: The person who performs work or provides services to another under an agreement or contract, and who receives a salary or remuneration in return.
membership.whoResponsibleTitle: WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CARRYING OUT AFFILIATION, REGISTRATIONS, TERMINATIONS AND CONTRIBUTING TO SOCIAL SECURITY?
membership.whoResponsibleText1: The person responsible and obliged to carry out affiliation, as well as to communicate the registrations and terminations of people who enter or cease their activity, is the employer, as well as to pay the contributions inherent to said affiliation act.
membership.whoResponsibleText2: For self-employed or AUTONOMOUS workers, the responsibility for doing so falls on themselves.
membership.whenTitle: FROM WHAT PERIOD SHOULD AFFILIATION BE CARRIED OUT?
membership.whenText: Affiliation must be carried out promptly at the start of work activity, no later than the eighth day.
membership.terminationText: Terminations are communicated by letter providing the requirements listed in the attached sheet, at the end of the employment contract and from the first fortnight of the month following the effects of the termination of the contractual relationship.
membership.privateSectorText: In simple terms, private sector workers are all those who work in companies or organizations that do not belong to the State.
membership.autonomousText: Self-employed (or liberal professions) are people who work on their own account, without being employees of a company or the State.
membership.publicSectorText: Public sector workers are people who work for the State, local authorities or public establishments. In other words, they provide services on behalf of the State, often paid with public money (taxes).

cardRequest.description: The affiliate card is the document that certifies your registration with INSESO and allows you to access social security benefits and services.

cardRequest.req4: Proof of affiliation or social security number
cardRequest.duplicateIntro: In case of loss or theft, you must present:

penalties.pageTitle: Penalties and Sanctions for Employers - INSESO
penalties.pageDescription: Information on penalties and sanctions applicable to employers for non-compliance with social security obligations
penalties.title: Penalties and Sanctions
penalties.legalFrameworkLead: The National Institute of Social Security (INSESO) has the authority to impose sanctions on employers who fail to comply with their obligations established in the Social Security Law of Equatorial Guinea.
penalties.legalFrameworkText: Compliance with social security obligations is fundamental to guarantee the protection of workers and the proper functioning of the system.
penalties.minorInfraction1: Delay in submitting monthly declarations (up to 30 days)
penalties.minorInfraction2: Non-substantial errors or omissions in declarations
penalties.minorInfraction4: Not displaying the affiliation certificate in a visible place
penalties.seriousInfraction1: Not affiliating workers within the established deadline
penalties.seriousInfraction2: Delay in contribution payments (1 to 3 months)
penalties.seriousInfraction3: Inaccurate declaration of salaries or number of workers
penalties.seriousInfraction4: Not deregistering workers who cease their activity
penalties.verySeriousInfraction1: Not affiliating any worker while having the obligation to do so
penalties.verySeriousInfraction2: Delay in contribution payments exceeding 3 months
penalties.verySeriousInfraction3: Falsification in documents or declarations submitted to INSESO
penalties.verySeriousInfraction4: Misappropriation of contributions deducted from workers
penalties.verySeriousInfraction6: Refusing to provide required information or documentation
penalties.verySeriousPenalty: Fine of 2,000,000 to 10,000,000 FCFA + possible temporary closure
penalties.latePaymentIntro: In addition to sanctions, late payment of contributions incurs automatic surcharges calculated on the amount owed:
penalties.surchargeNote: Surcharges are calculated automatically and are independent of sanctions that may be imposed for the infraction.
penalties.step2Text: The employer receives written notification of the alleged facts.
penalties.step3Text: 15 business days to present arguments and evidence.
penalties.step4Text: INSESO issues a reasoned resolution within 30 days.
penalties.step5Text: Possibility to appeal within 30 days to the competent authority.
penalties.precautionaryIntro: In cases of very serious infractions, INSESO may adopt precautionary measures while processing the case:
penalties.measure3Text: Suspension of activity in extreme cases
penalties.tip1Text: Meet monthly deadlines for declaration and contribution payments.
penalties.tip2Text: Register all your workers from the first day of work.
penalties.tip3Text: Verify that salaries and data are accurate in each declaration.
penalties.tip4Text: Keep your company and workers' information up to date.
penalties.tip5Text: Facilitate inspections and provide requested documentation.
penalties.tip6Text: When in doubt, contact INSESO before making mistakes.

prestaciones.title: SOCIAL BENEFITS
prestaciones.description: The Social Security system shall grant the following benefits:

about.presentationText1: INSESO is a Social Security institution responsible for managing the Social Security system for the benefit of workers and their dependents. It plays a central role in regulating relations between companies and workers in terms of social protection. The institution guarantees access to various social benefits based on solidarity and social justice.
about.presentationText2: Affiliation is the formal legal bond established between a company, its workers, and INSESO. It marks the integration of workers into the national Social Security system, granting them both rights - such as access to social benefits - and obligations, particularly the regular payment of contributions. This mechanism aims to guarantee equitable and lasting social protection, based on the principle of solidarity between generations and socio-professional categories.
about.missionText: To provide effective, accessible, and equitable social coverage to all insured persons, while supporting companies in meeting their legal obligations.
about.commitment1: Proper affiliation of companies and employees
about.commitment2: Rigorous collection and management of contributions
about.commitment3: Payment of Social Security benefits in accordance with acquired rights
about.commitment4: Awareness-raising on social protection and prevention of occupational risks
